1 Text: What are the three levels of war?
2 Text: Tactical (battles), Operational (campaigns), Strategic (achieving political objectives). The operational level only entered Western doctrine in 1982.

1 Text: When did the U.S. adopt the operational level of war?
2 Text: 1982, in FM 100-5 (AirLand Battle). Prior American doctrine only had 'tactics' and 'strategy'.

1 Text: Why does pre-WWII military text seem to conflate tactics and strategy?
2 Text: Because the operational level as a concept didn't exist in Western doctrine. It was borrowed from 1920s Soviet theory.
